org.opends.server.tools.tasks

Class TaskTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.tools.tasks.TaskTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaskScheduleInformation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackUpDB, ExportLDIF, ImportLDIF, RebuildIndex, RestoreDB

    public abstract class TaskTool
extends Object
implements TaskScheduleInformation
    Base class for tools that are capable of operating either by running local within this JVM or by scheduling a task to perform the same action running within the directory server through the tasks interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String NOW
      Magic value used to indicate that the user would like to schedule this operation to run immediately as a task as opposed to running the operation in the local VM.
      protected BooleanArgument runOfflineArg
      Argument used to know if the tool should be run in offline mode.

        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • processLocal

        protected abstract int processLocal(boolean initializeServer,
                                    PrintStream out,
                                    PrintStream err)
        Called when this utility should perform its actions locally in this JVM.
        Parameters:
        initializeServer - indicates whether to initialize the directory server in the case of a local action
        out - stream to write messages; may be null
        err - stream to write messages; may be null
        Returns:
        int indicating the result of this action

      • cleanup

        protected void cleanup()
        Cleanup task environment after offline run. Default implementation does nothing. Tasks which initialize some static part of the DirectoryServer instance (e.g admin data local backends) must override this method to shutdown all needed component to prevent JVM environment alteration.

      • createArgParser

        protected LDAPConnectionArgumentParser createArgParser(String className,
                                                       org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage toolDescription)
        Creates an argument parser prepopulated with arguments for processing input for scheduling tasks with the task backend.
        Parameters:
        className - of this tool
        toolDescription - of this tool
        Returns:
        LDAPConnectionArgumentParser for processing CLI input

      • getOfflineDescriptionMessage

        protected org.forgerock.i18n.LocalizableMessage getOfflineDescriptionMessage()

      • validateTaskArgs

        protected void validateTaskArgs()
                         throws ArgumentException,
                                ClientException
        Validates arguments related to task scheduling. This should be called after the ArgumentParser.parseArguments has been called.
        Throws:
        ArgumentException - if there is a problem with the arguments.
        ClientException - if there is a problem with one of the values provided by the user.

      • getStartDateTime

        public Date getStartDateTime()
        Gets the date at which this task should be scheduled to start.
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        date/time at which the task should be scheduled

      • process

        protected int process(LDAPConnectionArgumentParser argParser,
                      boolean initializeServer,
                      PrintStream out,
                      PrintStream err)
        Either invokes initiates this tool's local action or schedule this tool using the tasks interface based on user input.
        Parameters:
        argParser - used to parse user arguments
        initializeServer - indicates whether to initialize the directory server in the case of a local action
        out - stream to write messages; may be null
        err - stream to write messages; may be null
        Returns:
        int indicating the result of this action

      • runOffline

        public boolean runOffline()
        Indicates whether we must return if the command must be run in off-line mode.
        Returns:
        true if we must return if the command must be run in off-line mode and false otherwise.

      • checkVersion

        protected void checkVersion()
                     throws InitializationException
        Checks that binary version and instance version are the same.
        Throws:
        InitializationException - If versions mismatch
